meanings.sent1: The biunique relationship between the keys and values ensured each key had only one corresponding value.
meanings.sent2: The biunique mapping of each student to their locker made it easy to find belongings.
meanings.sent3: It was comical how the biunique seating arrangement at the party led to unexpected conversations.
meanings.sent4: The biunique connection between the puzzle pieces made it satisfying to complete.
meanings.sent5: The biunique pattern of the stripes on the zebra made it stand out from the herd.

meanings.definition: Being uniquely determined by its domain and codomain.
meanings.sent1: The biunique function was defined by its specific input and output values.
meanings.sent2: The biunique mathematical formula ensured a clear result for every calculation.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how the biunique recipe always turned out perfectly, no matter who tried it.
meanings.sent4: The biunique relationship between the star and its orbiting planets fascinated astronomers.
meanings.sent5: The biunique shape of the snowflake made it a beautiful and distinct creation.
